    crops.core.sequence module¶

    class Sequence(seq_id=None, imer=None, source=None)[source]¶

    Bases: object

    A sequence object grouping several chain sequence objects. The Sequence class represents a data structure to hold all

    monomer_sequence and other useful information

    characterising an oligomer.

    Parameters

    • seq_id (str) – Sequence identifier (e.g. PDB id).

    • imer (dict) – Container of several monomer_sequence making up the oligomer.

    • source (str) – Information concerning the source of the Sequence (e.g. Uniprot).

    Variables

    • seq_id – Sequence identifier (e.g. PDB id).

    • imer – Container of several monomer_sequence making up the oligomer.

    • source – Information concerning the source of the Sequence (e.g. Uniprot).

    Example

    >>> from crops.core import Sequence
>>> my_sequence = Sequence(seq_id='example_id', source='docs')
>>> my_sequence.add_monomer('header_example','GATTACA',nid='mychain')
>>> my_sequence.add_monomer('another_header','TACATACA')
>>> my_sequence.nchains()
2
>>> my_sequence.length('mychain')
7
>>> my_sequence.write('/path/to/output/dir/')
>>> print(my_sequence)
docs Protein/polynucleotide sequence object: (id='example_id', # chains = 2)
>>> my_sequence.purge()
>>> my_sequence.nchains()
0
    add_monomer(nheader, nseq, nid=None, forceentry=False)[source]¶

    Adds a new monomer_sequence to the Sequence.

    Parameters

    • nheader (str) – Standard .fasta header, starting with “>”.

    • nseq (str) – New sequence.

    • nid (str, optional) – New chain’s identifier, defaults to None

    • forceentry (bool, optional) – Switch to force entry under a new ID if nid already in, defaults to False

    Raises

    KeyError – When ID already in dictionary of monomer_sequence and forceentry=False.

    copy()[source]¶
    deepcopy()[source]¶
    del_monomer(nid)[source]¶

    Removes the selected monomer_sequence from the Sequence

    Parameters

    nid (str) – Doomed chain’s identifier

    Raises

    TypeError – When nid is not a string.

    imer¶
    kind = 'Protein/polynucleotide sequence'¶
    length(chain)[source]¶

    Returns the length of a certain sequence.

    Parameters

    chain (str) – ID of monomer_sequence.

    Raises

    • TypeError – When ‘chain’ is not a string.

    • KeyError – Specific chain not found in Sequence.

    Returns

    Length of monomer_sequence.

    Return type

    int

    Returns number of monomer_sequence in Sequence.

    Returns

    Number of monomer_sequence in Sequence.

    Return type

    purge()[source]¶

    Empties the Sequence without deleting the object itself.

    seq_id¶
    source¶
    write(outdir, infix='', single=None)[source]¶

    Writes all monomer_sequence to .fasta file.

    Parameters

    • outdir (str) – Output directory.

    • infix (str, optional) – Mark to distinguish from original input file, defaults to “”.

    • single (str, optional) – If not None, only monomer_sequence with ID given by single is written, defaults to None.

    Raises

    • FileNotFoundError – Output directory not found.

    • TypeError – Argument ‘single’ should be a string.

    • KeyError – Specific single ID not found in Sequence.

    class monomer_sequence(chid, seq=None, header=None)[source]¶

    Bases: object

    A sequence object representing a single chain sequence. The monomer sequence class represents a data structure to hold all sequences and other useful information characterising the monomer. It contains functions to store, manipulate and organise sequences.

    Parameters

    • chid (str) – Chain ID.

    • seq (str, optional) – Sequence string.

    • header – Standard .fasta header, starting with “>”.

    Variables

    • info – Useful information of the monomer_sequence.

    • seqs – The set of sequences, including default “mainseq”, in monomer_sequence.

    Example

    >>> from crops.core import monomer_sequence
>>> my_monomer = monomer_sequence('example_id')
>>> my_monomer.mainseq('GATTACA')
>>> my_monomer.mainseq()
'GATTACA'
>>> my_monomer.addseq('gapseq','GAT--C-')
>>> my_monomer.addseq('cobra','TACATACA')
>>> my_monomer.length()
7
>>> my_monomer.ngaps('gapseq')
3
>>> print(my_monomer)
Single chain sequence object: (id='example_id', seq='GATTACA', length=7)
    addseq(newid, newseq)[source]¶

    Add sequence to monomer_sequence.

    Parameters

    • newid (str) – New sequence’s identifier.

    • newseq (str) – New sequence.

    Raises

    • TypeError – If newid is not a string.

    • KeyError – If sequence is not a string.

    Deletes sequence(s) from monomer_sequence.

    Parameters

    • delid (str, optional) – ID of sequence to be deleted, defaults to None.

    • wipeall (bool, optional) – If True, all the sequences are deleted, defaults to False.

    Raises

    TypeError – If delid is not a string.

    dump(out)[source]¶

    Writes header and main sequence to a file. If file exists, output is appended.

    Parameters

    out (str, file) – An output filepath (str) or an open file.

    Raises

    TypeError – If out is neither a string nor an open file.

    mainseq(add=None)[source]¶

    Returns or modifies the main sequence.

    Parameters

    add (str, optional) – If included, main sequence is changed to ‘add’ sequence instead of returned, defaults to None

    Raises

    TypeError – If ‘add’ is not a string

    Returns

    If ‘add’ is None, the main sequence is returned.

    Return type

    str

    ncrops(seqid='cropseq', offterminals=False, offmidseq=False)[source]¶

    Returns the number of cropped elements (‘+’,’*’) in a sequence.

    Parameters

    • seqid (str, optional) – The ID of the sequence containing the cropped elements, defaults to ‘cropseq’.

    • offterminals (bool, optional) – Count those removed from terminals only, defaults to False

    • offmidseq (bool, optional) – Count those removed NOT from terminals only, defaults to False

    Raises

    TypeError – If seqid is not a string.

    Returns

    Number of cropped elements in seqid according to interval chosen.

    Return type

    int

    ngaps(seqid='gapseq')[source]¶

    Returns the number of gaps (‘-‘) in a sequence.

    Parameters

    seqid (str, optional) – The ID of the sequence containing the gaps, defaults to ‘gapseq’.

    Raises

    TypeError – If seqid is not a string.

    Returns

    Number of gaps in seqid.

    Return type

    int

    Returns the oligomer ID.

    Returns

    Oligomer ID.

    Return type

    seqs¶
    retrieve_id(seqheader, extrainfo=False)[source]¶

    Extracts sequence IDs from a standard .fasta header.

    Parameters

    • seqheader (str) – Standard .fasta header, starting with “>”.

    • extrainfo (bool, optional) – If True extra information string is returned, instead of sequence IDs, defaults to False.

    Raises

    ValueError – If seqheader is not a string.

    Returns

    A list with the two sequence identifiers (e.g. [pdb ID, chain ID]) or a single string if extrainfo==True.

    Return type

    list, str
